metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1056 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
X.org X server 1.13.3 and earlier, when not run as root, allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly gain privileges via vectors involving cached xkb files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.14.4-1ubuntu2
xdmx-tools - 2:1.14.4-1ubuntu2
xnest - 2:1.14.4-1ubuntu2
xserver-common - 2:1.14.4-1ubuntu2
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.14.4-1ubuntu2
xserver-xfbdev - 2:1.14.4-1ubuntu2
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.14.4-1ubuntu2
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.14.4-1ubuntu2
xvfb - 2:1.14.4-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.14.4-1ubuntu2').
